string.text: A sealed container you found on a dead stalker, it must be the shipment Sidorovich was talking about.
This PDA confirms Petrenko's missing soldier is dead after all. Looks like he gave as good as he got.

A computer encased in a reinforced container, according to the scientists this is a brand new detector prototype destined to change the world of artefact hunting. Unfortunately none of the graphs and numbers make any sense to you.

One stalker was supposed to bring me some special supplies from another trader but I haven't heard anything from him for some days, at first I thought he just ran away with the stuff but he hasn't hidden his location and didn't move for a while either. Maybe he just lost his PDA or even got killed, anyway I need someone to go there and check what happened. If he died and by chance still got the stuff bring it back.

Yes, there's a task I could assign to you, young lady. The situation we find ourselves in, is dire. Allow me to explain: one of our researchers went missing three days ago. Everything seemed to be in order during the first days, he had no issues scanning anomalous activity in specific areas we deemed safe, using a new prototype detector our team recently completed. But things changed when he began to notice strange hordes of mutants approaching his location.


According to our initial communications during his trip, the mutants were fleeing in all sort of directions, leading us to believe that something might have scared them. This is highly unusual, as mutants rarely leave the lair that they make their home, unless threatened by hunters. 
We've repeatedly tried to convince the SSU to send a team to investigate, but they've refused - claiming it's pointless to look after a single man.
Please, if you're willing to take on the impossible, go after this fellow ecologist and find out what happened to him. If he didn't make it out alive, I implore you for science's sake to retrieve the prototype detector that he carried. It took months of research and planning to develop, and we cannot afford to lose it.

Oh, there it is! You have no idea how much you have done for us all today! It is sad to lose another fellow researcher like this, and even more for the family behind this man... but we cannot grieve all day. Now what matters is that the device is safe, and the data stored in it will greatly help with the progression needed for our research to study the Zone. I will ensure that the sacrifice of this fellow researcher wasn't in vain with the provided data. \nHere is some proper payment for your consideration and heroism, young lady. Oh, and please, I invite you to talk to Spirit for food and water if you feel exhausted or to Peregrine if you want your gear to be repaired.

Earlier today, a light Duty patrol responded to a distress call from neutrals. They arrived in time to evacuate some stalkers and scientists caught in a major mutant attack, but one of the Dutyers had to stay behind to ensure the escape. The rest of his squad now lists him as missing in action. I'd like you to investigate the site of the attack and confirm his status. If he's alive, heal him as best you can then bring him back. If he cannot be saved, bring back his PDA instead; a martyr's records should be saved for posterity.

He's dead, then? He was a good man, but the Zone can be relentless in its hatred of such people. Here, let me take a look at his PDA... hm, interesting. On behalf of Duty, you have our gratitude. Here, you have more than earned this payment.
Return the detector to the scientists
Return the detector to the scientists
Return the detector to the scientists
Return the detector to the scientists
Return the detector to the scientists
Return the detector to the scientists
